cyclone.name: COLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 450 mi SW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating north-northeast, forecast to cross the Florida Big Bend Monday evening then sweep across north-central Florida and emerge over the Atlantic near Jacksonville before racing along the Southeast U.S. coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast near Apalachicola

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Altamaha Sound GA to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Indian Pass to Englewood on the Gulf coast, and Altamaha Sound GA southward to Sebastian Inlet FL (includes Cape Canaveral area)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida peninsula (Big Bend through east-central FL) and the coasts of Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible Monday evening into early Tuesday as the center passes north of the port
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding of 1–2 ft above ground level possible during high tide, plus rough surf and rip currents
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with localized higher pockets could cause ponding and drainage issues at port facilities
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible in outer rainbands Monday
